text.section:
To apply for a wholesale distributor permit, an applicant shall:
Pay to the Board an application fee set by the Board; and
Submit an application to the Board on the form that the Board requires.
The information required under subsection (b) of this section shall be provided under oath.

The designated representative and the immediate supervisor of the designated representative of an applicant shall submit to a criminal history records check in accordance with § 12-6C-05.1 of this subtitle.

section.section: In this subsection, "gross receipts" means gross receipts from sales of prescription drugs and devices in the State.
This subsection does not apply to a pharmacy warehouse that is not engaged in wholesale distribution.

An applicant for a wholesale distributor permit shall submit a surety bond or other equivalent means of security acceptable to the State, such as an irrevocable letter of credit or a deposit in a trust account or financial institution, payable to the State Board of Pharmacy to be deposited into an account established by the State under paragraph (7) of this subsection.

The surety bond or other security shall be in the amount of:
$100,000, if the annual gross receipts of the applicant for the previous tax year are $10,000,000 or more; or
$50,000, if the annual gross receipts of the applicant for the previous tax year are less than $10,000,000.
The Board may require by regulation documentation for the gross receipts of the wholesale distributor to qualify for a surety bond or other security in the amount of $50,000.

The purpose of the surety bond is to secure payment of any fines or penalties imposed by the Board and any fees and costs incurred by the State relating to the permit that:
Are authorized under State law; and
Are not paid by the permit holder within 30 days after the fines, penalties, fees, or costs become final.
The State may make a claim against the surety bond or other security until 2 years after the permit holder's permit ceases to be valid.
A single surety bond shall cover all facilities operated by the applicant in the State.
The Board shall establish an account, separate from its other accounts, in which to deposit the applicant's surety bond or other security.

text.section: If a wholesale distributor distributes prescription drugs or prescription devices from more than one facility, the wholesale distributor shall obtain a permit for each facility.

Within 30 days after the date the Board receives a completed application, including the results of all required criminal history records checks, the Board shall notify the applicant of the Board's acceptance or rejection of the application.
